review: All I wanted to do was be able to screencast from OSX/Windows/IOS/Android. Whatever's on my phone, or my laptop, or my desktop in my office, regardless of the OS running, or on my friend's laptop he just brought over on a whim, I want to show up on the "big screen" without a bunch of hassle. And I don't want to mess with VGA cables like I'm still in the 90's. It's the 21st century, we can livestream probes landing on comets - is it too much to ask to be able to do platform-independent wireless screencast to my TV?So after spending many hundreds of dollars over many years on half a dozen other big-brand media player devices that would do a mediocre-at-best job with a specific ecosystem of devices, and require hacks to make it work so-so with anything outside of that brand's ecosystem, or hacks to make it do useful things it should have done out of the box, I was pleasantly surprised to learn that the Chromecast that I picked up on a whim would do exactly what I wanted it to for a fraction of the money I had spent on other devices - about what I spend on a tank of gas. It even turns my TV on when I begin casting and changes to the correct HDMI input.I'm keeping the Chromecast, and Ebay'ing all the other crap.
author: Michael
